page.title: 20LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: The parish council meet on the last Wed. of each month except August. Chairman is Mr. K. Clamp and Vice Chairman is Mrs. G. Mann. Other members are Mrs. C. Slattery, Mr. J. Clifton, Mr. R. Hart, Mr. N. Clifton, Mr. P. Mitchell and Mr. T. Turner. the clerk is Mrs. D. Oakley. Shardlow Parish Council are responsible to the South Derbyshire Borough at Swadlincote. They are responsible to the Derbyshire County Council at Matlock. The present rates are 205p in the pound. Of this the county get 185p, the borough get 19p and the parish get 0.8p, this raises nearly Â£1000. Elections take place every 4 years. Two problems the council have are noise from Warings and parish dyke drainage ditch. The population was 891 in 1981. It is now approx. 900 due to new housing.
